## What Is Crash Gambling?

**Crash gambling** is a simple but thrilling casino game where you bet on how high a multiplier will climb before it “crashes.”

**The basic concept:**
1. You place a bet (any amount)
2. A multiplier starts climbing: 1.00x → 1.50x → 2.00x → 3.00x…
3. You cash out BEFORE the crash
4. If you cash out: You win your bet × multiplier
5. If it crashes before you cash out: You lose your bet

**Example:**
“`
Bet: $10
Multiplier climbs: 1.00x → 1.50x → 2.00x → 2.50x → CRASH!
You cash out at 2.00x: Win $20 ($10 profit) ✅
You wait too long: Lose $10 ❌
“`

**That's it.** Simple rules, fast action, big potential wins.

—

## How Crash Games Work: The Math Behind the Multiplier

Crash games use **provably fair algorithms** based on cryptographic hashing:

**Two inputs create the crash point:**
1. **Server seed** — generated by the casino (hidden)
2. **Client seed** — chosen by you (or random)

These combine through SHA-256 hashing to produce a crash multiplier.

**The process:**
1. Before the round, the casino shows you the **hashed server seed** (encrypted)
2. You see the multiplier climbing in real-time
3. You decide when to cash out
4. After the crash, the casino reveals the actual server seed
5. You can verify the round was fair using online tools

**Why this matters:** It proves the casino can't manipulate the crash point mid-round. The outcome is determined BEFORE the round starts.

**Learn more about provably fair in our guide:** [Is Crash Gambling Rigged?](https://crashcasino.io/is-crash-gambling-rigged/)

## Bankroll Management: Don't Go Broke

**The #1 mistake beginners make:** Betting too much per round.

**Safe bankroll management:**
– **Max bet per round:** 1-3% of total bankroll
– **Stop-loss:** Quit if you lose 20% of bankroll
– **Stop-win:** Quit if you win 50% of bankroll
– **Never chase losses** — increasing bets after losing is a recipe for disaster

**Example:**
“`
Starting bankroll: $100
Max bet: $1-3 per round
Stop-loss: Lose $20 → quit
Stop-win: Win $50 → quit
“`

**Why this matters:** Even with 99% RTP, variance can bust you. Proper bankroll management keeps you in the game.

—

## Understanding Crash Game Odds

**House edge:** Most crash games have 1% house edge (99% RTP)

**What this means:**
– Over thousands of rounds, you'll lose 1% of total bets
– Short-term: Anything can happen (win streaks, lose streaks)
– Long-term: The house edge ensures casino profit

**Probability examples:**
“`
Cash out at 1.5x: ~66% chance of success
Cash out at 2.0x: ~50% chance of success
Cash out at 3.0x: ~33% chance of success
Cash out at 10x: ~9% chance of success
“`

**The higher you target, the lower your success rate.**

## Common Beginner Mistakes to Avoid

### ❌ Mistake #1: Betting Too Large

**Wrong:** Bet $50 from a $100 bankroll (50%!)
**Right:** Bet $1-3 from a $100 bankroll (1-3%)

**Why:** One bad streak wipes you out.

—

### ❌ Mistake #2: Greedy Cashouts

**Wrong:** Always targeting 10x, 100x multipliers
**Right:** Set realistic targets (1.5x-3x)

**Why:** High targets = low success rate. You'll bust more often than you win.

—

### ❌ Mistake #3: No Auto-Cashout

**Wrong:** Trying to time the cashout manually
**Right:** Always set auto-cashout as a safety net

**Why:** Humans react too slow. By the time you click, it's too late.

—

### ❌ Mistake #4: Chasing Losses

**Wrong:** “I lost $20, let me bet $50 to win it back”
**Right:** Stick to your bet sizing, accept losses as part of the game

**Why:** This is how gamblers go broke. Never bet more than you planned.

—

### ❌ Mistake #5: Ignoring Provably Fair

**Wrong:** Playing crash games without verification
**Right:** Only play provably fair crash games

**Why:** Without verification, you're trusting a black box. Provably fair proves honesty.

## Crash Gambling Terminology

**Multiplier:** The climbing number (1.00x, 2.00x, 3.00x…)
**Crash point:** When the round ends (game over)
**Auto-cashout:** Automatic sell order at preset multiplier
**Provably fair:** Cryptographic proof of fair gameplay
**House edge:** Casino's advantage (usually 1%)
**RTP:** Return to player percentage (usually 99%)
**Volatility:** Risk level (how much results swing)
**Bankroll:** Total gambling funds
**Round:** One complete game (bet → climb → crash)
